Overview.Summary: In the 2023 Swiss federal election, all members of the National Council and Council of States were elected (1). The late delivery of voting and election material caused frustration among Swiss citizens living abroad (7). The Swiss People's Party focused on immigration and cost of living in their campaign (9). Galaxus, a Swiss online retailer, also launched their own election campaign (10). The Swiss-Israeli Association and Israeli officials criticized a visit by Hamas to Switzerland (3). In the first half of 2023, Swiss Life reported good financial results (2). Opinion polling was conducted for the upcoming Swiss federal election (4). President Berset called for stability in the Balkans (6). Chinese tourists have been avoiding Switzerland (6). The Swiss army helped clear a landslide by building a bridge (6).

Timeline.Text: Opinion polling begins for the 2023 Swiss federal election.
Swiss Life reports good Halbjahresergebnis (semi-annual results) for 2023.
Switzerland Today reports on Chinese tourism, President Berset's call for Balkans stability, and the army's efforts to clear up a landslide.
Galaxus, a Swiss online retailer, launches its own election campaign.
Political parties begin campaigning for the 2023 Swiss federal election.
Swiss citizens living abroad express frustration at the late delivery of voting and election material.
Hamas's visit to Switzerland sparks outcry and reignites debate over the group's presence in the country.
The Swiss federal election takes place, with a predicted increase in support for the right-wing party due to their focus on immigration and energy security.
The Swiss federal election results are announced, with the right-wing party making gains.

Overview.Summary: The Swiss federal election of 2023 is a highly anticipated event (1, 2, 4, 14, 18). It will be a significant moment for the future of basketball in Switzerland (1). The permanent resident population is expected to surpass nine million for the first time by the end of the first half of 2023 (3). The right-wing populist Swiss People's Party has dominated the election (11). Over 5.5 million voters are expected to cast their votes for the 200-seat National Council and 46-seat Council of States (10). The Swiss abroad will also be participating in the election (17). The glossary of Swiss federal elections (14, 19) and the official Swiss federal election portal (20) provide useful information for understanding the election process.
